arts.ttl: Liverpool to begin negotiations to sign “massively underrated” star in a club-record deal
arts.sum: Liverpool could lose Mohamed Salah when his contract expires at the end of the season, and they have already identified a potential target to replace him. Real Madrid attacker Rodrygo Goes has been identified as a potential replacement for the Egyptian international. arts.ttl: INSIDE SPORT: The truth about Mohamed Salah's 'contract signing' video at Albert Dock - and the key detail Everton overlooked in Bramley-Moore Dock stadium plans
arts.sum: MIKE KEEGAN: Previous manager Sean Dyche was not consulted on the layout of the 52,888-capacity venue on the banks of the River Mersey and something was pointed out when he left.

arts.ttl: Liverpool sent scouts to watch “quality player” on Tottenham & Newcastle radar yesterday
arts.sum: Liverpool are looking to improve their attacking unit, and they are keeping tabs on the Ipswich Town striker, Liam Delap. Tottenham Hotspur and Newcastle United are keen on the player as well. According to a report from TBR Football, all three clubs sent scouts to watch the 22-year-old striker in action on Saturday. Delap has […] The post Liverpool sent scouts to watch “quality player” on Tottenham & Newcastle radar yesterday appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Liverpool’s title stumble shows strength of Premier League, not its weakness | Barney Ronay
arts.sum: Fulham were excellent in beating the champions-elect and credit should be given to the mid-table tier’s progression Here it comes then. The much‑promised collapse. The improbable, but somehow also deserved and collectively willed disintegration of these champions by default. Something like that anyway. Tell you what though. Fulham are good aren’t they? And particularly so, it should be said, for a team that started the day 10th in an apparently mediocre league. Or is that not part of the story? At the end of a fun, boisterous 3‑2 victory for Marco Silva’s excellent, vigorous upper‑midtable team the talk will of course be about Liverpool, and not necessarily in a very flattering way. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Fulham STUN leaders Liverpool with comeback win
arts.sum: Fulham clung on to win back-to-back home matches in the Premier League for the first time since March 2024, and Silva will be determined to build on that momentum against fellow European hopefuls AFC Bournemouth next time out. Fulham held on to beat Liverpool 3-2 at Craven Cottage, with the Premier League leaders failing to open up a 14-point gap at the top of the table.

arts.ttl: Arne Slot rejects reason for Liverpool loss after recent Jamie Carragher concerns
arts.sum: Liverpool were hit with just their second Premier League defeat of the season at Fulham but Arne Slot maintained a lack of changes had no impact on their loss in the capital
